description: Ensure that the Docker socket file ownership is set to root:docker (Automated)
title: Ensure that the Docker socket file ownership is set to root:docker (Automated)
documentation: You should run the following command: chown root:docker /var/run/docker.sock. This sets the ownership to root and group ownership to docker for the default Docker socket file.

description: Ensure that the version of Docker is up to date (Manual)
title: Ensure that the version of Docker is up to date (Manual)
documentation: You should monitor versions of Docker releases and make sure your software is updated as required.

description: Ensure that the /fenced/mnt/host/etc/sysconfig/docker file ownership is set to root:root (Automated)

documentation: You should run the following command: chown root:root /fenced/mnt/host/etc/sysconfig/docker. This sets the ownership and group ownership for the file to root.

description: Ensure that registry certificate file permissions are set to 444 or more restrictively (Automated)
title: Ensure that registry certificate file permissions are set to 444 or more restrictively (Automated)
documentation: You should run the following command: chmod 444 /fenced/mnt/host/etc/docker/certs.d/<registry-name>/*. This would set the permissions for the registry certificate files to 444.

description: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /etc/sysconfig/docker (Automated)
title: Ensure auditing is configured for Docker files and directories - /etc/sysconfig/docker (Automated)
documentation: Install auditd. Add -w /fenced/mnt/host/etc/sysconfig/docker -k docker to the /fenced/mnt/host/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules file. Then restart the audit daemon using command service auditd restart.

description: Ensure that docker.socket file ownership is set to root:root (Automated)
title: Ensure that docker.socket file ownership is set to root:root (Automated)
documentation: Find out the file location: systemctl show -p FragmentPath docker.socket. If the file does not exist, this recommendation is not applicable. If the file exists, run the command chown root:root <path> to set the ownership and group ownership for the file to root.
